txt.en: 'There they are. Look at them! My blade thirsts for their blood, [placeholder].\n\n'We ride!'
Instance: In Need of Cheering-up
Éowyn is ready to face the foe that threatens Edoras.
Follow Éowyn
Listen to Éowyn
Fight alongside Éowyn.
Rouse Éowyn from her unhappy reverie
Éowyn has fallen
Join Éowyn in battle
Speak with Éowyn.
Listen to Éowyn
Fight alongside Éowyn
Éowyn is in need of cheering up, though she hides her dire mood well for the sake of her people.

'Come, let us talk while we walk. What is it you wished to say to me?'\n\nYou tell Éowyn that you know of the sadness she hides beneath her cool, brave exterior, and that some people are grown deeply worried for her.
Éowyn is in Edoras.\n\nYou should speak with Éowyn.

'That was the most fun I've had in...I cannot even remember! Was that not a wonderful rush, [placeholder]?

'I have half a mind to ride out and find another enemy to slay...but I must return, I know. The women and children and elderly must get to Dunharrow safely, and it is my duty to make it so.

'Come, let us return to Edoras.'
Éowyn has agreed to bring you along
Speak with Éowyn
'We have done it!'
You have defeated the warband that threatened the refugees of Edoras!
Éowyn is in Edoras.\n\nYou should follow Éowyn.
Éowyn is in Edoras.\n\nYou should speak with Éowyn.
Speak with Éowyn
Éowyn is in Edoras.\n\nYou should listen to Éowyn.
Éowyn is in Edoras.\n\nYou should speak with Éowyn.
Éowyn looks at you once more, startled
Éowyn's eyes are far away as you look at her, a bitterness upon her fair features that is sad to look upon.\n\nYou gently speak her name, and she looks at you once more, her reverie broken.
'All right, all right! You may come with me, if you wish. I would not deny the wishes of such a worthy [placeholder].\n\n'Let us leave at once! I long for battle.'
